intro: Vaccinium forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes huckleberry, is a low-growing shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue to black in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Vaccinium forbesii plays an important ecological role by providing food for wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
